result.execSummary:
The defendant KEVIN S. ECKSTEIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Bond of $3,500.00 applied to costs.  Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts immediately after court. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED as a condition of probation.

08:54 AM Defendant KEVIN S. ECKSTEIN in court, in custody.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KEVIN S. ECKSTEIN appeared by video means.  Advised of rights.  DE requests bond reduced to a signature bond.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law to address bond.  The State objects to anything less than $2000 cash.  The Court will amend to $3500 cash bond.  The DE requests more time to hire an attorney prior to a prelim.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Bond Continues.  Record closed @ 9:02.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
